      Used by selection algorithms to store a value representing how crowded the fitness space is relative to other individuals with the same rank (on the same Pareto front), most useful for multi-objective selection algorithms such as NSGA-II.

    • Field Detail

      • PRIMARY_PERFORMANCE_KEY

        public static final java.lang.String PRIMARY_PERFORMANCE_KEY
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • m_fitnessValue

        protected double[] m_fitnessValue
        Stores the fitness value(s) of this Chromosome as determined by the active fitness function(s). A value of Double.NaN indicates that a fitness value has not yet been set.

      • m_performanceValue

        protected java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> m_performanceValue
        Stores the performance value(s) of this Chromosome as determined by the active fitness function(s). A performance value is a measure of the performance of a Chromosome that is not used to determine the fitness of an individual in the evolutionary process. A value of Double.NaN indicates that a performance value has not yet been set.

      • m_overallFitnessValue

        protected double m_overallFitnessValue
        Stores the overall fitness value of this Chromosome, either as determined by the active fitness function or as determined by the NaturalSelector based on the fitness values over all objectives. A value of Double.NaN indicates that a fitness value has not yet been set.

      • rank

        public int rank

      • novelty

        public double novelty
        May be used by implementations of novelty search.
        See Also:
        NoveltySearch

      • behaviours

        public Behaviour[] behaviours
        May be used by implementations of novelty search. An array is used so that multiple behaviours may be defined.
        See Also:
        NoveltySearch

      • crowdingDistance

        public double crowdingDistance
        Used by selection algorithms to store a value representing how crowded the fitness space is relative to other individuals with the same rank (on the same Pareto front), most useful for multi-objective selection algorithms such as NSGA-II.

      • evaluationDataStable

        protected boolean evaluationDataStable

    • Constructor Detail

      • EvaluationData

        public EvaluationData(int objectiveCount,
              int behaviourCount)

    • Method Detail

      • getFitnessValue

        public double getFitnessValue()
        Returns the overall fitness value of this Chromosome, either as determined by the active fitness function or as determined by the NaturalSelector based on the fitness values over all objectives. Fitness values are in the range [0, 1], however the value Double.NaN indicates that a fitness hasn't been set yet.

      • getFitnessValue

        public double getFitnessValue(int objective)
        Returns the fitness value of this Chromosome for the given objective, as determined by the active fitness function. Fitness values are in the range [0, 1], however the value Double.NaN indicates that a fitness hasn't been set yet.

      • getFitnessValues

        public double[] getFitnessValues()
        Returns a reference to the array of fitness values for this Chromosome for each objective, as determined by the active fitness function. Fitness values are in the range [0, 1], however the value Double.NaN indicates that a fitness hasn't been set yet.

      • setFitnessValue

        public void setFitnessValue(double a_newFitnessValue)
        Sets the overall fitness value of this Chromosome. This method is for use by bulk fitness functions and should not be invoked from anything else. This is the raw fitness value, before species fitness sharing. Fitness values must be in the range [0, 1].
        Parameters:
        a_newFitnessValue - the fitness of this Chromosome.

      • setFitnessValue

        public void setFitnessValue(double a_newFitnessValue,
                   int objective)
        Sets the fitness value of this Chromosome for the given objective. This method is for use by bulk fitness functions and should not be invoked from anything else. Fitness values must be in the range [0, 1].
        Parameters:
        a_newFitnessValue - the fitness of this Chromosome.

      • setFitnessValues

        public void setFitnessValues(double[] values)
        Sets all the fitness values of this Chromosome. This method is for use by bulk fitness functions and should not be invoked from anything else. Fitness values must be in the range [0, 1].
        Parameters:
        values - new fitness values for this Chromosome.

      • getPerformanceValue

        public double getPerformanceValue()
        Returns the primary performance value of this Chromosome as determined by the active fitness function. The primary performance is either the performance value with key PRIMARY_PERFORMANCE_KEY if it exists, otherwise the value for the first key (keys are sorted alphabetically). Performance values are in the range [0, 1], however the value Double.NaN indicates that a performance value hasn't been set yet.

      • getPerformanceValue

        public double getPerformanceValue(java.lang.String key)
        Returns the specified performance value of this Chromosome as determined by the active fitness function. Performance values are in the range [0, 1], however the value Double.NaN indicates that a performance value hasn't been set yet.

      • getAllPerformanceValues

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> getAllPerformanceValues()
        Returns all of the performance value(s) of this Chromosome as determined by the active fitness function(s). Performance values are in the range [0, 1], however the value Double.NaN indicates that a performance value hasn't been set yet. The keys of the returned Map are the labels for the performance metric. The Map is sorted alphabetically.

      • setPerformanceValue

        public void setPerformanceValue(double aPerformanceValue)
        Sets the primary performance value of this Chromosome. This method is for use by bulk fitness functions and should not be invoked from anything else. Performance values must be in the range [0, 1].
        Parameters:
        aPerformanceValue - the fitness of this Chromosome.

      • setPerformanceValue

        public void setPerformanceValue(java.lang.String key,
                       double aPerformanceValue)
        Sets the specified performance value of this Chromosome. This method is for use by bulk fitness functions and should not be invoked from anything else. Performance values must be in the range [0, 1].
        Parameters:
        key - the identifier of the performance value to set.
        aPerformanceValue - the new performance value.

      • setPerformanceValues

        public void setPerformanceValues(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> values)
        Sets the specified performance values of this Chromosome. This method is for use by bulk fitness functions and should not be invoked from anything else. Performance values must be in the range [0, 1].
        Parameters:
        values - The new performance values to set.

      • resetPerformanceValues

        public void resetPerformanceValues()
        Resets the performance value of this Chromosome to Double.NaN.

      • resetFitnessValues

        public void resetFitnessValues()
        Resets the fitness value(s) of this Chromosome to Double.NaN.

      • resetEvaluationData

        public void resetEvaluationData()
        Resets the performance, fitness value(s) and recorded novelty behaviours(s) of this Chromosome.

      • setEvaluationDataStable

        public void setEvaluationDataStable()
        Indicate that the evaluation data (e.g. fitness, performance, behaviours) is stable: it won't change in future evaluations. This only has an effect if the fitness function pays attention to this value, and the effect that it has may vary between implementations.

      • isEvaluationDataStable

        public boolean isEvaluationDataStable()
